Half blown by the boom, half running, Trelos let out a help as he flew
acro=
ss the open area in front of the government tower and slammed head-first
in=
to the side of a building.  With a growl, he transformed back into beast
mo=
de and began to run toward the enemy, still not quite sure where it was.

"=
I think we should pull out." said Ravenchief.

"No argument there," said De=
pthcharge, holding one hand up to his ear, still
reeling from the shockwave=
.

Both transformed and began a mostly-verical flight out of the city.

On =

lf down to a seated position as he watched
Trelos and the ones he pursued. =
He tilted his head almost quizzically as he
observed Trelos stop the chase =
and turn to look at him.

As Trelos looked at him the lion stood, a small s=
trange passing along the
feline=E2=80=99s face, caution . . . curiosity . .=
 . recognition . . .

> <OLD>


>
> "Maximal team, this is base," crackled =
Salveo's voice over the radio.
 "What's your situation?"...
The look quickl=
y congealed into anger as some of the indiscriminant
firepower scored along=
 the armored lion=E2=80=99s shoulder, as well as the pedestal
that he had b=
een perched upon.

Leaping to another bit of debris, this one a little lowe=
r to the ground, he
turned to look at Trelos as his tail swished behind him=
. His optics glowed
as he opened his great fanged jaws, and the growl that =
had been in his chest
finally erupted into a full throated ROAR as he let t=
he full fury of a
200-decibel burst of sound energy flow along the ground a=
nd buildings and
who ever got in its wake!

ength of a sonic boom!

 into the side of a building.=C2=A0 With a growl, he transformed back into =
beast mode and began to run toward the enemy, still not quite sure where it=
 was.</p>

<p>"I think we should pull out." said Ravenchief.</p>
=
<p>"No argument there," said Depthcharge, holding one hand up to =
his ear, still reeling from the shockwave.</p>
<p>Both transformed and bega=
n a mostly-verical flight out of the city.</p>
